concerts.name: Monica Naranjo
concerts.info: Hace 22 años Monica Naranjo se enfrentó a un cruce de carreteras, podía seguir con los deseos de su discográfica y producir un disco como Palabra de Mujer o podía escuchar a la artista que llevaba dentro y producir el disco que ella quería y por el cual sería siempre recordada. Tras una dura lucha en el año 2000, Mónica saca a la venta su tercer disco, Minage, un gran tributo a la intérprete italiana Mina, logrando tres discos de platino en España y un disco de oro en México, convirtiéndose en uno de los discos más importantes en la historia del pop español. Ahora, dos décadas después y después de una triunfal gira por España, Mónica regresa al país que la vio nacer como artista y que la convirtió en uno de los referentes musicales por excelencia, para presentar su recital homónimo, PURO MINAGE, en el que solamente interpretará acompañada de la majestuosidad de un piano, las canciones de este inolvidable disco, en un concierto íntimo y muy especial

concerts.name: Haragan Y Cia
concerts.info: Han pasado casi tres décadas desde que Luis Alvarez "el Haragán" debutara por pri-mera vez en un escenario, "Muñequita sintética" ,"Él no lo mató", " Tú mamá no me quiere", " Historia de un minuto" entre muchas otras, son canciones que forman parte de la cultura popular. Para celebrar sus 30 años de exitosa carrera ininterrumpida, Luis Alvarez "El Ha-ragán y cía" darán un show especial, la cita será esté próximo domingo 19 de abril del 2020 en el coloso de Paseo de la Reforma. Los boletos tendrán un costo de $ y estarán disponibles para venta a todo el publico a partir de este jueves 1 de agosto en el sistema ticketmaster y taquillas del auditorio. El festejo por su 30 aniversario será único e irrepetible, un viaje por toda su discogra-fía, sus éxitos; canciones que forman parte de la memoria colectiva, con 11 discos, en donde coquetean con ritmos que van desde rock hasta el blues.

concerts.name: Ricky Martin
concerts.info: El ídolo de multitudes ofrecerá a sus seguidores un espectáculo completo, al reunir una gran parte de sus éxitos como "Livin' La Vida Loca", "Shake Your Bon Bon" y "Vuelve", sumados a los más recientes en su amplia discografía, como son "La Mordidita" y "Venta Pa'Ca" y un adelanto de los temas que el artista está creando para el álbum con el que volverá a sorprender en el 2020. Será un montaje de la más alta tecnología, con el diseño de escenario e iluminación más tecnológicamente avanzados de su carrera. Cada canción representará en el escenario nuevas inspiraciones temáticas que funcionarán como complemento a la interpretación del astro puertorriqueño y a las impresionantes coreografías de su cuerpo de baile.

concerts.name: Maroon 5
concerts.info: Tras su última y exitosa visita a la CDMX el pasado mes de febrero de 2020, la banda norteamericana liderada por el carismático cantante y actor Adam Levine, Maroon 5, vuelve a la carga musical, y para beneplácito de sus fieles admiradores mexicanos, ofrecerá un delirante y emocionante show el próximo miércoles 30 de marzo de 2022 y qué mejor encuentro con sus aliados aztecas que en las instalaciones del Foro Sol, lugar que han visitado en anteriores ocasiones con gran éxito. Como en sus pasadas producciones, Maroon 5 apostó de nueva cuenta por un sonido pop. Son 14 canciones entre las que destacan Beautiful mistakes donde colaboró la artista Megan The Stallion, Remedy en compañía de Stevie Nicks, Echo juntó a Blackbear. Asimismo, hay colaboraciones de H.E.R en el tema Convince me, Juicy WRLD en Can't leave you alone, Button con Anuel AA y Tainy, Lifestyle con Jason Derulo, entre otros."
concerts.pleaseNote: with lyrics written by former Australian immigration minister and Senator Amanda Vanstone. The song is set to the tune of the first of the Pomp and Circumstance Marches by Edward Elgar (or the same as the better-known song set to the same music Land of Hope and Glory)

concerts.name: Imagine Dragons
concerts.info: Imagine Dragons is an American pop rock band from Las Vegas, Nevada, consisting of lead singer Dan Reynolds, guitarist Wayne Sermon, bassist Ben McKee and drummer Daniel Platzman.The band first gained exposure with the release of their single It's Time, followed by their award-winning debut studio album Night Visions (2012), which resulted in the chart-topping singles Radioactive and Demons
concerts.pleaseNote: For the health and safety of everyone attending, this event will abide by local laws, guidance from public health authorities, and venue COVID-19 policies. While there are currently no restrictions, enhanced health and safety policies, including the requirement of a negative COVID-19 test (or alternatively proof of full vaccination), may be put in place at any time prior to the show date at the discretion of the venue, presenter, or tour.
concerts.openHoursDetail: Service Hours: The Enterprise Center Box Office is currently open Monday and Wednesday 10:00am-5:00pm. Short-term parking is available in front of the building, or in the garage attached to Enterprise Center. Enter the garage from Clark Avenue or 16th Street. Cash is accepted. Checks and credit cards are not accepted for garage parking. DOORS OPEN: -60 minutes prior to game time for Blues -Other events vary by show
concerts.acceptedPaymentDetail: Box Office Accepts Cash, Money Orders, MasterCard, Visa, American Express, Discover and Diners Club Card.
concerts.willCallDetail: Customer must present actual credit card used to place the order, the confirmation number and a photo ID. Tickets held at Will Call may be picked up beginning 2 hours prior to show time.
concerts.parkingDetail: GUEST PARKING: Approximately 6500 parking spaces are available within 1,800 feet of Enterprise Center, including at 1,270-car garage situated immediately adjacent to the building. In addition, many nearby parking garages and surface lots offer affordable, convenient access to Enterprise Center. "Enterprise Center Parking" signs at the entrances to these parking facilities should help in directing Enterprise Center guests to appropriate parking. Ample street parking is also available. BOX OFFICE PARKING: Short-term daytime parking for ticket purchases at Enterprise Center's Box Office is available on Clark Avenue in front of the Box Office (15 min. limit) as well as in the attached Enterprise Center Garage. DROP-OFF / PICK-UP: Drop-off and pick-up for guests attending events at Enterprise Center should be made at the 14th Street Entrance at the east end of the building. After an event, 14th Street is closed by the St. Louis Police.
concerts.generalRule: For information on specific events, phone (314)622-5400. General rules are as follows: BAG POLICY: To reduce contamination, bags, including clear bags, purses and clutches, will not be permitted at games or events. Medical and parent bags are exceptions, but will be subject to Xray screening at designated locations for entry into Enterprise Center. STILL CAMERAS: Policy varies by event, is determined solely at the discretion of the show, and is subject to change without notice. Still cameras are permitted for St. Louis Blues games, most other sporting events and most family shows. Still cameras are not permitted for most concerts. VIDEO CAMERAS: Are NOT permitted for most events. RECORDING DEVICES: Are NOT permitted. PROHIBITED ITEMS: Cans, bottles, coolers, plastic beverage containers, food or beverage of any kind, helium balloons, pets (other than service animals), laser pointers, sticks (excluding those on pennants or flags) and weapons of any sort. SMOKING: For most events, Guests are permitted to exit and re-enter the Enterprise Center at the 14th Street Entrance (section 122) and the West Entrance (section 109). Smoking is permitted at these locations. Hand stamps and ticket stub are required to re-enter the building.
concerts.childRule: Discounts are offered for children on a show by show basis. For more information regarding specific performances, please phone (314)622-5400.

Call (Phone) Center: Monday thru Friday: 10:00 AM to 5:00 PM Saturday: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM Sunday: CLOSED Types of Payment Accepted Visa, Mastercard, Discover, American Express, Cash Location The ExtraMile Arena Box Office is located on the East side of the Arena, just to the right of Entrance 2 and adjacent to the Albertson’s Stadium parking lot.
concerts.acceptedPaymentDetail: Visa, Mastercard, Discover, American Express, Cash
concerts.willCallDetail: Will Call is located at the Box Office. For events that occur on a weekday, the office will open at 10:00am. For events occurring on Saturday or Sunday, the office will open at 12:00pm. *Location* The ExtraMile Arena Box Office is located on the East side of the Arena, just to the right of Entrance 2 and adjacent to the Albertson’s Stadium parking lot.
concerts.parkingDetail: ExtraMile Arena encourages patrons to allow at least 45 minutes to park and access ExtraMile Arena. Parking is sold in advance for the Arena and Stadium lots, as well as Lincoln Garage. For patrons who did not pre-purchase parking, a parking fee will be collected by an attendant as you enter the parking lots. Depending on the event, parking costs typically range from $5.00 to $15.00. For parking prices for a particular event or to purchase parking, please contact the Box Office at (208) 426-1766. On the day of an event, parking can no longer be purchased prior to arrival. Patrons will need to purchase parking in cash when they arrive on-site for the event. Parking lots open 1 hour before doors.
concerts.generalRule: All guests entering the Arena may be subject to metal-detector screening, visual inspection, and bag inspection conducted by ExtraMile Arena security personnel. Prohibited items include anything that can be deemed a threat to public safety by ExtraMile Arena and include, but are not limited to, the following: video recording or streaming devices, iPads, selfie sticks, outside food or drink, large bags or backpacks, weapons of any kind including chains, spikes, collars, some jewelry or any implement that could be used as a weapon, fireworks/pyrotechnics of any kind, laser pointers, glow sticks or flashbulbs. Smoking and vaping are not permitted inside the venue.
concerts.childRule: All persons entering the venue require a ticket. Children’s events may have a unique policy for infants/toddlers; contact the Box Office for ticketing policies for a specific event. Please ask an Usher about our SAFE program which provides wristbands for reuniting individuals that may become separated from their party.

concerts.name: Under The Southern Stars
concerts.info: Under Southern Stars is an Australian patriotic song with lyrics written by former Australian immigration minister and Senator Amanda Vanstone. The song is set to the tune of the first of the Pomp and Circumstance Marches by Edward Elgar (or the same as the better-known song set to the same music Land of Hope and Glory).      Vanstone worked on the song for six years as a secret project, before releasing it in early 2007. She stated that the song came about after a discussion with some friends on Australia Day, where it was decided that Australia lacked a song with similar gravitas as the national anthem, Advance Australia Fair. She denied that the song was intended to replace or rival the national anthem, but could be played alongside it, and other classic and modern Australian patriotic songs such as Waltzing Matilda and True Blue at public events.

concerts.name: Jessie J
concerts.info: FEMININE ENERGY THROUGH THE MUSIC  Jessie J, the British pop star who has succeed with hits such as Bang Bang and Price Tag,returns to Starlite Catalana Occidente on July 22nd 2022. Lyrics with a lot of intention and girl-power attitude that will fill the quarry with strength through their most iconic songs. Some of them, from her solo debut Who You Are which went platinum and reached six top 10 radio hits. Among them, Price Tag reached number 1 in 18 territories and went quadruple platinum. In 2018 she released ROSE, an album that reflects her transformation and which sold out worldwide.  A decade after she started covering classic songs, Jessie J's voice just keeps getting better and bigger. This year she released the first single, I Want Love from her new project, produced by Ryan Tedder.    On July 22nd, Jessie J returns stronger than ever to Starlite Catalana Occidente 2022.

concerts.name: Maluma
concerts.info: MALUMA, THE ICON OF URBAN REGGAETON Maluma will be back on the Auditorium stage of Starlite Catalana Occidente on Wednesday, July 20th 2022.    Leader of the urban genre and recognized with countless awards in the music industry, Maluma will make the festival audience dance again with his latest project 'Papi Juancho', with which he has already revolutionized the scene thanks to songs like “Hawaii”, “Parce ” or “Madrid”     Since his rise to fame with the single “Farandulera” and his debut album ‘Magia’ in 2011, the Colombian artist has not stopped reaping successes. His worldwide hits, among which we can find “11 PM”, “Felices los 4”, “Obsesión”, “El Primonio”, “Borró Cassette” or “Mala mía”, have led him to reach the top positions on numerous occasions on the most popular lists.

concerts.name: Sebastian Yatra
concerts.info: SEBASTIÁN YATRA, LATIN TALENT THAT TRANSCENDS GENRES The leader of Latin pop, Colombian singer and songwriter, Sebastián Yatra, will revisit Starlite Catalana Occidente on Thursday, June 23rd.  Following his sweeping performances in 2018 and 2021, Sebastián Yatra will once again take to the Auditorium stage of the boutique festival to provide an unforgettable night for the Marbella audience, who will enjoy both his latest hits and the consolidated tracks of his meteoric musical career.  Yatra's talent lies in his vocal transformation and his ability to transcend genres with his voice as his main tool. His groundbreaking and catchy choruses, sung from the heart, have made him a multi-award-winning artist who has already achieved his eighth Latin GRAMMY nomination; this time in the category of Best Pop Song for his ballad 'Adiós', a song co-written with Pablo Lopez.  The audience at Starlite Catalana Occidente will be able to enjoy her latest work, the album 'DHARMA', which with its single 'Tacones Rojos' has climbed the charts all over the planet, with more than 98 million plays, including 31 million for its video. The 17-track album demonstrates the artist's versatility in different musical styles.

concerts.name: Il Divo
concerts.info: IL DIVO, THE FIRST CROSSOVER BAND OF CLASSICAL MUSIC  Starlite Catalana Occidente 2022 will welcome Il Divo, the great quartet of tenors, who will be taking the Auditorium stage of the boutique festival on Friday, July 8th.  Formed by Urs Bühler, Sèbastien Izambard, Carlos Marín and David Miller, Il Divo has pioneered the opera pop genre of classic crossover music and is considered one of the main musical phenomena of the century, with more than 30 million albums sold and 160 Gold hits and platinum certificates in 35 different countries. Il Divo is able to reinterpret great successes known by everyone, and capture their audience forever.

concerts.name: Pablo Alboran
concerts.info: PABLO ALBORÁN, A TRIP THROUGH THE MOST EMOTIONAL UNIVERSE Starlite Catalana Occidente will once again welcome the warm voice and emotive lyrics of one of the most important Spanish artists on the current scene, Pablo Alborán, who will perform on the 9th of JULY in the Festival Auditorium.  Since his beginnings in 2010, the singer-songwriter and musician from Malaga has garnered more than 30 awards, including multiple Latin Grammy nominations, two Golden Seagulls and two Silver Seagulls at the Viña del Mar Festival in Chile, Goya Award for best original song and 11 awards at Los40 Music Award, to name a few.  Since his beginnings in 2010, the singer-songwriter and musician from Malaga has garnered more than 30 awards, including multiple Latin Grammy nominations, two Golden Seagulls and two Silver Seagulls at the Viña del Mar Festival in Chile, Goya Award for best original song and 11 awards at Los40 Music Award, to name a few.  His lyrics, written and sung from the bottom of his soul, as well as his characteristic way of telling stories have led him to be recognized and admired both for his talent and sensitivity as well as for his charismatic personality.  Castillos de arena' is the third single from his sixth studio album that will be released in 2022 and that Pablo Alborán will offer to his unconditional public next JULY 9TH at Starlite Catalana Occidente.

concerts.name: Lionel Richie
concerts.info: LIONEL RICHIE, THE AMERICAN ICON FROM THE 80’S Starlite 2022 confirms the show of Lionel Richie, as the international superstar will be performing at the Auditorium stage of the festival on Tuesday, July 26th.      With a discography of albums and singles that are second to none, Lionel Richie will be back singing for the festival audience. This time, the American icon will come along as part of the spectacular musical journey that is staring his latest “Hello” tour.      Multi awarded and with more than 100 million albums sold worldwide, an Oscar, a Golden Globe, and four Grammy Awards among many other, the singer known for mega hits such as “Endless Love”, “Lady”, “Truly” or “All Night Long” will lead an evening full of emotions, making prove why he is part of the fabric of pop music.      It will be a night to get carried away by the energy and good vibes of this huge artist, on Tuesday, July 26th at Starlite Festival.

concerts.name: Andres Calamaro
concerts.info: ANDRÉS CALAMARO, SPANISH ROCK ICON Andrés Calamaro will perform for the first time at Starlite Catalana Occidente 2022 to present his new project and share the anthems of his career on Wednesday, July 27th.      The Argentine singer-songwriter, musician, composer and producer, multi-award-winning throughout his nearly 45-year musical career, will take the stage at Starlite Catalana Occidente Auditorium to review his greatest hits accompanied by his entire band.Andrés Calamaro, the multi-awarded Argentinean artist, launched last June his new album 'Dios Los Cría', in which he revisits his exceptional discography together with several of the greatest artists of Latin popular music, from legends like Julio Iglesias in 'Bohemio', Raphael 'Jugar con fuego' and 'Flaca' with Alejandro Sanz, 'Flaca' with Alejandro Sanz, 'Para no olvidar' with Manolo García and Vicente Amigo or 'Paloma' with artists such as Sebastian Yatra, Leiva, Iván Ferreiro, 'Pasemos a otro tema' with Julieta Venegas, 'Tuyo siempre' with Vicentico, 'Engánchate conmigo' Juanes and Niño Josele, among other greats...With this album he was again nominated for the Latin Grammy for Best Pop Vocal Album and Record of the Year for the song 'Bohemio' with Julio Iglesias and won the Latin Grammy for Best Song with the song Hong Kong with C. Tangana.      Undoubtedly, an exceptional opportunity to enjoy one of the best Spanish rock artists in Starlite Catalana Occidente. Live Andrés Calamaro in concert, next Wednesday, July 27th, 2022.

concerts.name: Simple Minds
concerts.info: Simple Minds are a Scottish rock band formed in Glasgow in 1977. They have released a string of hit singles, becoming best known internationally for Don't You (Forget About Me) (1985), which topped the Billboard Hot 100 in the United States. Other commercially successful singles include Glittering Prize (1982),Someone Somewhere in Summertime (1982),Waterfront (1983) and Alive and Kicking (1985), as well as the UK number one single Belfast Child (1989).

concerts.name: Diana Krall
concerts.info: DIANA KRALL, THE ELEGANCE OF JAZZ RETURNS TO STARLITE CATALANA OCCIDENTE 2022 Singer and pianist, Diana Krall returns to our festival to fill the quarry with soul. The Canadian artist has made a name for herself in the industry, and her acoustic jazz will undoubtedly be the star of an extraordinary night at Starlite Catalana Occidente 2022.  Since her debut in 1993 with Stepping Out she has become a jazz reference, thanks to great hits such as Only Trust Your Heart, All for You or Love Scenes.But the album that took Krall to the top commercially was When I look in your eyes, which, as well as remaining at number 1 on the Billboard jazz chart for 52 weeks, won the Grammy in two categories: Best Jazz Vocal Performance and Best Album, Non-Classical. Many hits have followed, such as her best-selling album The look of love.

concerts.name: Camilo
concerts.info: CAMILO, THE NEW LATIN POP THAT CONQUERS THE WORLD Camilo, the musical phenomenon that has revolutionized pop worldwide, will return to Starlite Catalana Occidente 2022 on Tuesday, August 2nd.  The Colombian performer, composer, musician and producer, winner of the Latin Grammy 2020 and nominated for the American Grammy 2021, is an international reference that has more than five billion plays on all digital platforms around the world.  Gifted with impeccable songwriting skills and an intuitive sensibility, Camilo has conquered the music industry, critics, and audiences across generations, which has made him the Latin artist with the largest number of followers on TikTok: 21.6 million.  In addition, he has written songs for musical stars such as Becky G & Natti Natasha, Bomba Estéreo Mau & Ricky & Karol G, Sebastian Yatra & Mau & Ricky, as well as Bad Bunny, among many others.  Since his debut in 2019, the Medellín native has touched the hearts of millions of people with catchy songs and choruses that transmit good vibes, included in his two studio albums. Proof of this are the hits 'Tutu', 'Vida de rico', 'No te vayas', 'BEBÉ', 'Ropa cara' or 'KSI'.  After making the world fall in love with 'Indigo', the international artist presented 'Pesadilla', the second single from his anticipated new album that will be released in 2022. 'Pesadilla' was born out of his fascination for the Mexican roots sonority that has always inspired him and has been part of his life, while its lyrics explore the contrast of feelings about the loss of a love that only happened in a nightmare and the celebration that came upon awakening from it.

concerts.name: Malú
concerts.info: MALÚ, OVERWHELMING FORCE ON STAGE Malú, one of the most important female voices of our country, will return to the Starlite Catalana Occidente Auditorium on AUGUST 3rd, 2022.  A brilliant and overwhelming Malú will return to the stage of Starlite Catalana Occidente to offer a vibrant concert in which she will present the best of her consolidated professional career and the most recent hits of her latest work 'Mil batallas'.  The artist from Madrid will once again delight the spectators of Starlite Catalana Occidente with one of the most powerful and awaited live performances of the national scene. The strength of her voice, the spectacular staging and a great production will provoke a real whirlwind of emotions among attendees, who will take time to forget the musical experience.  Malú is a singer, composer and performer. She has sold more than two and a half million records since the beginning of her career in 1998 and has received awards such as the “Medal of Andalusia” and several prizes including the “Ondas Award” for Best Artist of the Year and 15 Dial Awards, which have made her one of the most awarded Spanish artists.

concerts.name: Jon Stevens
concerts.info: Stevens was born in Upper Hutt, New Zealand,and is of Scottish and Māori descent. His brother is singer Frankie Stevens.[3] He formed his first band while at Heretaunga College.[4] Stevens released his debut studio album Jezebel on CBS Records in 1980. It peaked at number 7 on the New Zealand charts and was certified Gold. He moved to Australia in 1981 and subsequently became an Australian citizen.[5] In 1982, a self-titled album was released, but was not successful. In 1983, Stevens formed the band the Change with guitarist Stuart Fraser. Over the next few years, additional members were added before renaming themselves as Noiseworks in 1986.

concerts.name: SummerSalt
concerts.info: As kids, SUMMER SALT knew what they were running toward. Now, they’re ready to ruminate on what they’ve left behind.  In a way, the trop-pop duo – singer/guitarist Matthew Terry and drummer Eugene Chung – have been building to their brand-new album, SEQUOIA MOON, ever since jettisoning their Dallas, Texas, hometown for the arts-and-culture oasis of Austin after graduating high school in the early 2010s. The band quickly rose through the ranks of the local Austin scene with their 2014 debut Driving To Hawaii, teeming with both the escapism and recklessness of youth and the composure and charm of ‘60s-era pop, doo wop and bossa nova.

concerts.name: The Black Sorrows
concerts.info: The Black Sorrows are an Australian blues rock band formed in 1983 by mainstay vocalist Joe Camilleri (ex-Jo Jo Zep & The Falcons), who also plays saxophone and guitar. Camilleri has used various line-ups to record 17 albums, with five reaching the top 20 on the ARIA Albums Charts: Hold on to Me (September 1988), Harley and Rose (August 1990), Better Times (September 1992), The Chosen Ones - Greatest Hits (November 1993) and Lucky Charm (November 1994). Their top 40 singles are Chained to the Wheel (February 1989), Harley + Rose (August 1990) and Snake Skin Shoes (July 1994).

concerts.info: 1927 are an Australian pop rock band formed in 1987 with James Barton on drums, Bill Frost on bass guitar, his brother Garry Frost on guitar and keyboards, and Eric Weideman on vocals, guitar and keyboards. They were popular in the late 1980s and early 1990s with their major hit songs That's When I Think of You, If I Could, Compulsory Hero and Tell Me a Story. Their multi-platinum number-one album, ...ish (1988) was followed by The Other Side (1990). At the ARIA Music Awards of 1989 they won two categories: Breakthrough Artist – Album for ...ish and Breakthrough Artist – Single for That's When I Think of You. At the 1990 ceremony they won Best Video for Compulsory Hero, which was directed by Geoff Barter. In 1992 the group released a third studio album, 1927, which reached the top 40; but they disbanded the following year. Weideman reformed 1927 in 2009 with a new line-up.

concerts.name: Paul Kelly
concerts.info: Paul Kelly (June 19, 1940 – October 4, 2012[citation needed]) was an American singer-songwriter. He is best known for the soul songs Stealing in the Name of the Lord, which was a major hit in 1970, and Hooked, Hogtied & Collared. He also wrote Personally, which has been widely covered, and was a hit for soul singer Jackie Moore and singer-songwriter Karla Bonoff and country singer Ronnie McDowell. Other songs have been covered by gospel artists, including the Mighty Clouds of Joy and The Staple Singers.

concerts.name: Ed Sheeran
concerts.info: In 2018 Ed Sheeran did three sold out and totally unforgettable shows in Sweden – two at Ullevi and one at Friends Arena. Now he returns!Divide Tour, that ran between 2017 and 2019, broke every record. Night after night Sheeran packed arenas around the world with euphoric fans, and it became the biggest tour ever. For + - = ÷ x Tour (The Mathematics Tour) Ed has created a completely new, unique experience. With new favorite tracks and a completely new production he will perform on a round stage surrounded by fans, who will get even closer to their idol than during the last tour.Regardless if you’ve seen Ed Sheeran live before or not – you don’t want to miss the chance to see him live at Ullevi in 2022! Get ready for new hits and old favorites, sing-along and pure happiness, love and friendship. Maybe we will even shed a tear or two. In 2022 we will create new memories for life! Tickets go on sale on September 25th at 12:00 only through Ticketmaster.

concerts.name: Alicia Keys
concerts.info: Alicia Augello Cook (born January 25, 1981), known professionally as Alicia Keys, is an American singer, songwriter and actress. A classically trained pianist, Keys began composing songs by age 12 and was signed at 15 years old by Columbia Records. After disputes with the label, she signed with Arista Records and later released her debut album, Songs in A Minor, with J Records in 2001. The album was critically and commercially successful, producing her first Billboard Hot 100 number-one single Fallin and selling over 12 million copies worldwide. The album earned Keys five Grammy Awards in 2002. Her second album, The Diary of Alicia Keys (2003), was also a critical and commercial success, spawning successful singles You Don't Know My Name, If I Ain't Got You, and Diary, and selling eight million copies worldwide.The album garnered her an additional four Grammy Awards. Her duet My Boo with Usher became her second number-one single in 2004. Keys released her first live album, Unplugged (2005), and became the first woman to have an MTV Unplugged album debut at number one. Her third album, As I Am (2007), produced the Hot 100 number-one single No One, selling seven million copies worldwide and earning an additional three Grammy Awards. In 2007, Keys made her film debut in the action-thriller film Smokin' Aces. She released the theme song to the James Bond film Quantum of Solace Another Way to Die with Jack White.

concerts.name: Alvaro Soler
concerts.info: Álvaro Tauchert Soler is a Spanish-German singer. He rose to prominence across Europe and Latin America with his 2015 hit El Mismo Sol, primarily hitting success in Italy, Switzerland and Mexico. A special bilingual Spanish-English version of El mismo sol, featuring Jennifer Lopez, was also recorded for international release in the United States, in the United Kingdom, and worldwide.His follow up single Sofia in 2016 also achieved chart success in European countries, reaching number 1 in Poland, Italy, the Czech Republic, Slovakia, Belgium and Switzerland. Soler has released three studio albums, Eterno Agosto in 2015, Mar de Colores in 2018, and Magia (Álvaro Soler album) in 2021. His single La Cintura taken from his second album has become a pan-European hit for him.

concerts.name: Ricardo Arjona
concerts.info: Edgar Ricardo Arjona Morales (born 19 January 1964), known as Ricardo Arjona is a Guatemalan singer-songwriter. Arjona is one of the most successful and best-selling Latin American artists of all time, with more than 20 million records sold.He is often called El Animal Nocturno (The Nocturnal Animal), thanks to his breakthrough success with his fourth studio album, which bears the same name. His music ranges from ballads to Latin pop, rock, pop rock, Cuban music, and more recently a cappella performances and a mixture of Tejano music and Norteño music, and other Afro-American and Latin sounds. Arjona is noted for his lyrical style, and often addresses topics such as love, sexuality, violence, racism and immigration.

concerts.name: Billie Eilish
concerts.info: Billie Eilish Pirate Baird O'Connell is an American singer and songwriter. She first gained public attention in 2015 with her debut single Ocean Eyes, which was subsequently released by Darkroom, a subsidiary of Interscope Records. The song was written and produced by her brother, Finneas O'Connell, with whom she frequently collaborates on music and in live shows. Her debut extended play, Don't Smile at Me (2017), was commercially successful and charted within the top 15 in the US, UK, Canada, and Australia.Eilish's first studio album, When We All Fall Asleep, Where Do We Go? (2019), debuted atop the US Billboard 200 and reached number one in the UK. It was one of the best-selling albums of 2019, buoyed by the success of its fifth single and Eilish's first number-one hit on the Billboard Hot 100, Bad Guy. In 2020, she co-wrote and performed the theme song No Time to Die for the James Bond film of the same name, which topped the UK singles chart. Her next singles Everything I Wanted, My Future, Therefore I Am, and Your Power each peaked within the top 10 in the US and UK; her sophomore album, Happier Than Ever (2021), reached number one in 25 countries.

concerts.name: Simply Red
concerts.info: Simply Red are a British soul and pop band formed in Manchester in 1985. The lead vocalist of the band is singer and songwriter Mick Hucknall, who, by the time the band initially disbanded in 2010, was the only original member left.Since the release of their debut studio album Picture Book (1985), they have had ten songs reach top 10 in the UK Singles Chart, including Holding Back the Years and If You Don't Know Me by Now, both of which reached number one on the US Billboard Hot 100. They have had five number one albums in the UK, with their 1991 album, Stars, being one of the best-selling albums in UK chart history

concerts.name: Justin Bieber
concerts.info: Justin Drew Bieber is a Canadian singer. He was discovered by American record executive Scooter Braun and signed with RBMG Records in 2008, gaining recognition with the release of his debut seven-track EP My World (2009) and soon establishing himself as a teen idol.  Bieber achieved commercial success with his teen pop-driven debut studio album, My World 2.0 (2010), which debuted atop the US Billboard 200, making him the youngest solo male act to top the chart in 47 years. The album also contained the internationally successful single Baby, which became one of the highest certified singles of all time in the US. His second studio album, Under the Mistletoe (2011), became the first Christmas album by a male artist to debut at number one in the US.His third studio album, Believe (2012), saw him experiment with dance-pop.In 2013, Bieber became the first and youngest act in history to have five US number-one albums at the age of 18.Following Believe, Bieber was involved in various controversies and legal issues between 2013 and 2014, which had a drastic impact on his public image.

concerts.name: JoJo
concerts.info: Joanna Noëlle Levesque known professionally as JoJo, is an American singer, songwriter, and actress. Raised in Foxborough, Massachusetts, she began performing in singing competitions and local talent shows from a young age. In 2003, record producer Vincent Herbert noticed her after she competed on the television show America's Most Talented Kids and asked her to audition for his record label Blackground Records. Having signed with them that same year, JoJo released her eponymous debut studio album the following year in June 2004. It peaked at number four on the US Billboard 200 and was later certified platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA), selling over four million copies worldwide to date

concerts.name: Shawn Mendes
concerts.info: Shawn Peter Raul Mendes is a Canadian singer and songwriter. He gained a following in 2013, posting song covers on the video-sharing application Vine. The following year, he caught the attention of artist manager Andrew Gertler and Island Records A&R Ziggy Chareton, which led to him signing a deal with the record label. Mendes's self-titled debut EP was released in 2014, followed by his debut studio album Handwritten in 2015. Handwritten debuted atop the US Billboard 200, making Mendes one of five artists ever to debut at number one before the age of 18. The single Stitches reached number one in the UK and the top 10 in the US and Canada.

concerts.info: Aerosmith is an American rock band formed in Boston in 1970. The group consists of Steven Tyler (lead vocals), Joe Perry (guitar), Tom Hamilton (bass), Joey Kramer (drums) and Brad Whitford (guitar).
